Title: Xamlr
Description: A XAML formatteR for Visual Studio 2010, 2012 and 2013
HomeWiki:
What is Xamlr?

Xamlr is a XAML formatteR extension for Visual Studio versions 2010, 2012 and 2013 that enables WPF and Silverlight developers to work with their XAML files more effectively; both on an individual basis and as part of a team. It does this by overriding the inbuilt formatting logic for XAML files to produce beautiful, easy to read and easy to merge XAML at lightning speed.

How do I use Xamlr?

  1. Download the version that matches your version of Visual Studio.
  2. Run the installer and restart Visual Studio if prompted.
  3. In Visual Studio open any XAML document (ensure it is not read-only).
  4. Save the document.
Tip you can disable format on save in Tools --> Options --> Xamlr and format using the Visual Studio document formatting command: you will probably find that CTRL E, D is a good shortcut combination.

See the documentation for more details or jump to the XAML style guide for an in depth explanation of how Xamlr will format your document.
